chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Forney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Incest with Child by Stepparent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1m).
  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Forney to 30 years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 20 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 10 years. This sentence is to begin FORTHWITH

State's Letter to the Court regarding Sentence Modification and 2/23/17 Motion hearing.
Motion hearing on February 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 11:05am.
Defendant Robert J. Forney appears via videoconferencing from Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Jospeh Fischer appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin, along with DOC Agent Carrie Reuhl.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court has scheduled this hearing related to the letter of DOC Agent Reuhl requesting that the Judgment of Conviction be amended to prohibit Mr. Fomey from possessing photos of the victims. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; the victim and a parent are present in court. 
Attorney Fischer raises that the State has not filed a formal motion on this issue. 
After discussion with counsel on the requirements of Statute 973.19, the Court requires the State to file a written motion which will include the source of law that would authorize the Court to order the requested additional condition of Extended Supervision by 1/31/17.
The Defense may file a written response. 
recess 11:16am.

NEXT: Continued hearing on State's Motion to Amend the Judgment of Conviction on February 23 at 11:00am--arrangments are to be made for Mr. Forney to appear via video for this hearing.

It is further ordered that, on our own motion, we hereby extend the time to file the respondent's brief to 12/7/16.

Case called at 10:58am [mo]
Defendant Robert J. Forney in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Brookellen Teuber and ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber and ADA Hall
Statements made by Victim's Parents

Statement made by Amy Kuchenbecker on behalf of Defendant
Statement made by Theresa Gromer on behalf of Defendant
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Fischer
Statement made by Defendant


On Count #1 and #2: 
The Court sentences Mr. Forney   to  30  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  20  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 10  years.  
On Count #1: This sentence is to begin FORTHWITH
On Count #2: The Sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 

On Count #3: 
The Court sentences Mr. Forney  to  6  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Counts #1 and #2.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  45   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--sex offender evaluation and follow- through with recommended treatment
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of any controlled substances or paraphernalia
--random drug screening
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--compliance with Sex Offender Registry
--No Contact with SRB (dob: 4/23/1997)
--No Contact with MJF (dob: 3/1/2005) or SIF (3/26/2007), until the age of 18 and then with consent of DOC and MJF and SIF
--No Contact with any minors under the age of 18, unless expressly authorized by Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Case called at 9:04am [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC and Motion to Suppress]
Defendant Robert J. Forney in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On the Defendant's Motion to Suppress:
--The Court acknowledges receipt and review of all Motion documents from State and Defense, including DVD.
--Atty. Fischer clarifies that there is no Goodchild issues, only Mr. Forney's right to counsel
--Atty. Fischer gives argument in support of motion
--The Court and Counsel discuss the State's 10/22/15 Letter Brief
--The Court and Counsel verify there are no factual disputes of the Interview
--ADA Hall gives argument
--The Court recites the statement made by Mr. Forney in question, regarding counsel and case law.
--The Court finds that the Defendant's statement is ambiguous(could have more than one meaning), gives possible interpretations.
--The Court finds that there is no Miranda violation, the Defense's Motion to Suppress is denied. 
--The Court finds that Mr. Forney reinitiated contact with the law enforcement officer.


The Court and Counsel discuss Jury Trial posture:
--ADA Hall indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to trial
--Atty. Fischer requests an adjournment, based on the Court's ruling on the Motion to Suppress and plea negoitiations
--The Court directs that the Jury Trial remain on the calendar as scheduled; the Court will not delay the Trial
--Counsel indicate that 2 days are needed for Trial
--States Witnesses: 4
--Defenses Witnesses: 5/6
--The Court will carry one alternate on the jury
--Each party is entitled to 5 strikes
--Jurors are allowed to take notes and ask questions

The Defense is to notify the Court by tomorrow by 9:30am if Mr. Forney will enter a plea; Atty. Fischer will contact the Court to notify of change of plea and then schedule a hearing time tomorrow (10/29/15)
recess:9:38am

NEXT: Jury Trial on 11/2 AND 11/3/2015 at 8:30am (already scheduled)

Case called at 9:03am.  Clerk - CRHI. (Case scheduled for Prelinimary Hrg. and Bond Modification Hrg.) 
Defendant Robert J. Forney in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Procedural and scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel.
Victim rights compliance verified. 
Waiver of Prelim. Hrg. -
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial.
Information filed by the State.
Case continued for Arraignment. 

Bond modification hearing - 
Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Atty. Fischer informs that Court of a proposed agreement that the no contact condition that written communications between the defendant and his two minor children be allowed.  Further that the written communications would be reviewed by the GAL prior to it being provided by the children.  If the GAL does approve the materials, they will not be provided to the children. 
Additional information provided by the State. 
The Court grants the motion and orders that the bond condition be modified to reflect a single exception that the defendant may have written communications with his two children.  That the communications are to be provided to the GAL for review and approval.  If approved, the communications will be forwarded to the children.
Recess 9:15am.

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
Arraignment - to be scheduled.

[MK] case called at 2:25pm. 
Defendant Robert J. Forney in court with Attorney Joseph F  Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Forney verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are current. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Attorney Fischer requests modification of the Signature Bond condition that prohibits contact with minor females, to allow Mr. Forney to have contact with his daughters pursuant to any Family Court Order and under conditions as granted by such Family Court Order, and for an exception to have supervised contact with minor females at employment.
After hearing arguments from counsel, the Court denies the request.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.
recess 2:45pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 6/8/15 at 9:00am.
Defendant's
Attorney Fischer

**Minutes from 03/27/15 Bail/Bond Hearing from 15GF51**

Case called at 1:25 pm [sf]
Defendant Robert J. Forney appears in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County State Public Defenders Office. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock advises that the State filed a probable cause statement, and requests 30 days to file a complaint.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
Court finds probable cause.

Court requires $50,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with SRB (DOB: 4/23/1997) or TAS (DOB: 9/24/1978) 
-No contact with any female under the age of 18
-Not to utilize the internet except for work purposes
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons

Bond will lapse if no complaint is filed within 30 days.
recess: 1:30 pm
